author: Staff Reporter
text:
“My dream is to create an art centre in Chennai,” Oscar winning composer A. R. Rahman said during the 100{+t}{+h}show of Y. Gee Mahendra’s play ‘Paritchaikku Neramachu’ on Sunday.

Recollecting his association with Mr. Mahendra, he said it was a challenge to stage a play. “Cinema is something we all see, but it takes a great deal to create and develop good art like Mr. Mahendra does,” he added.

Mr. Mahendra said Rahman is a genius and an exceptional human being. “He has come all the way from Los Angeles just for the play,” he added. He said there is no dearth of good theatre artists in the State and people should come to watch good plays. Both a stage and cine actor, Mr. Mahendra noted how important rehearsals are for cinema. “Back then, actors used to rehearse for films at least for a month,” he said.

‘Paritchaikku Neramachu’— that tells a touching story about the bond between a father and his son— by United Amateur Artists Troupe, was staged back in 1978 and then later made into a film with Sivaji Ganesan in the lead and Mr. Mahendra playing the role of his son (Varadhu Kutty).

“Sivaji sir is like my father. Every minute I spent with him was a learning process,” he added.
title: Rahman wants to create art centre
